page.title: 01EDUCATION IN BIRCH
page.content: The{Church of England Aided School caters for children from 5-11 yrs. who live in the{villages}of Birch, Layer Breton, Layer Marney, Salcott, Wigborough, Peldon and Hardys Green. Most of the children travel to school by bus, car or taxi and only a few children walk because the has no footpath. The neat school of white brick was founded in{1847}by Charles Gray Round to provide a Christian{Education}for the children of the village. The Round family still reside in the village. Since the foundation of the school there has been several additions to the building. During the last year the school has been enlarged and remodelled at a cost of 165,000 pounds. The school has accomodation for 120 pupils and on leaving go to Stanway or Thurstable Comprehensive.
